intro: Noccaea atila-ocakii, commonly known as the Turkish stonecress, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to Turkey and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat. Noccaea atila-ocakii is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
